required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity and Safety of Rotavirus RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) in Neonates
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity and Safety of Rotavirus RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) in Neonates, Lot to Lot Consistency and Antigen Interference With Co-Administered EPI Vaccines (Phase III)

brief_summary.textblock: This phase III trial aims to assess the immunogenicity and safety of Rotavirus RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) in neonates, lot-to-lot consistency, and antigen interference with co-administered EPI vaccines

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, six-arm parallel-group study to investigate the safety and immunogenicity following three doses of rotavirus RV3 vaccine (Bio Farma) administered as a neonatal schedule

primary_outcome.measure: Serum immune response (sIgA) following third dose
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with ≥ 3 times increase in serum anti-rotavirus IgA (sIgA) from baseline to 28 days after the third dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum anti-rotavirus IgA (sIgA) following third dose
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with ≥ 3 times increase in serum anti-rotavirus IgA (sIgA) from baseline to 28 days after the third dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum anti-rotavirus IgA (sIgA) following second dose
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with ≥ 3 times increase in serum anti-rotavirus IgA (sIgA) from baseline to 28 days after the second dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum anti-rotavirus IgA (sIgA) following first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with ≥ 3 times increase in serum anti-rotavirus IgA (sIgA) from baseline to 28 days after the first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum neutralizing antibodies (SNA) following third dose
secondary_outcome.description: Description of serum neutralising antibodies (SNA) level [percentage of subjects with positive SNA(≥ 100), two fold and three fold increasing antibodies] from baseline to 28 days after the third dose [in a subset of 80 participants per arm]

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titre (GMT) following third dose
secondary_outcome.description: Geometric mean titre (GMT) of serum IgA and serum neutralising antibodies (SNA) 28 days after the third dose
Detectable RV3 excretion in stool (by PCR) any day from day 3 to day 5 following each dose

At least a threefold increase in serum anti-rotavirus IgA or SNA from baseline to post rotavirus vaccine dosing, or detectable RV3 excretion in stool (by PCR) any day from day 3 to day 5 following each dose
Vaccine take observed at the current assessment time point or following any previous dose
Percentage of subjects with ≥ 3 times increase in serum anti-rotavirus IgA (sIgA) from baseline to 28 days after the third dose
Reciprocal titre ≥ 1:8 against poliovirus strains 1-3 measured 28 days after bOPV4+ IPV and Pentabio 3 vaccination

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after the third dose
secondary_outcome.description: Number of solicited and unsolicited Adverse Events (AE), from randomization to 28 days following last dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after the third dose
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Serious Adverse Events (SAE), from randomization to 28 days following last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: AE and SAE compared to placebo
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after the third dose
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events (SAE), from randomization to 28 days following last dose, compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Abnormality of ALT and AST levels
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormality of ALT and AST levels measured 28 days following first dose, assessed as probably or definitely related to the dosing

arm_group.arm_group_label: Main Study I - RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) Batch 1
arm_group.description: 3 oral doses of RV3 vaccine (Bio Farma) batch 1; administered at 0-5 days, 8-10 weeks, and 12-14 weeks of age.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Main Study I - RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) Batch 2
arm_group.description: 3 oral doses of RV3 vaccine (Bio Farma) batch 2; administered at 0-5 days, 8-10 weeks, and 12-14 weeks of age.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Main Study I - RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) Batch 3
arm_group.description: 3 oral doses of RV3 vaccine (Bio Farma) batch 3; administered at 0-5 days, 8-10 weeks, and 12-14 weeks of age.
3 oral doses of Placebo; administered at 0-5 days, 8-10 weeks, and 12-14 weeks of age.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Main Study II - RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma)
arm_group.description: 3 oral doses of RV3 vaccine (Bio Farma) with the addition of antacid prior to dose 2 and 3; administered at 0-5 days, 8-10 weeks, and 12-14 weeks of age.
3 oral doses of Placebo with the addition of antacid prior to dose 2 and 3; administered at 0-5 days, 8-10 weeks, and 12-14 weeks of age.

intervention.description: Each 1 mL dose of the final product of oral liquid rotavirus vaccine contains > 5x10^6 fcfu/mL rotavirus vaccine strain RV3
intervention.arm_group_label: Main Study I - RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) Batch 1
Main Study I - RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) Batch 2
Main Study I - RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma) Batch 3
Main Study II - RV3 Vaccine (Bio Farma)

intervention.description: Each 1 mL dose of placebo contains 30% of sucrose in DMEM

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Neonate 0-5 days (0-144 hours) of age at the time of first dose.
2. Neonate is in good health as determined by clinical judgment, including a medical history and physical exam, which confirms the absence of a current or past disease state considered significant by the investigator.
3. The neonate was born full term (minimum of 37 completed weeks and maximum of 42 completed weeks gestation).
4. Neonate birth weight 2500-4000 g inclusive.
5. Parent or guardian has been informed properly regarding the study and signed the informed consent form.
6. Parent or guardian commits to comply with the instructions of the investigator and the schedule of the trial.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject concomitantly enrolled or scheduled to be enrolled in another trial.
2. The subject has direct relatives relationship with the study team.
3. The subject has evolving mild, moderate or severe illness, especially infectious diseases or fever (axillary temperature ³ 37.5°C) within the 48 hours preceding enrollment.
4. Subject with a known or suspected history of allergy to any component of the vaccines (based on anamnesis).
5. Subject with a biological mother with a known or suspected human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection.
6. Subject with known or suspected major congenital malformations or genetically determined disease.
7. Subject with intussusception.
8. Subject with a known or suspected disease of uncontrolled coagulopathy or blood disorders contraindicating for phlebotomy.
9. Subject with a known or suspected disease of the immune system or those who have received immunosuppressive therapy, including immunosuppressive courses of systemic corticosteroid.
10. Subject who have ever received any blood products, including immunoglobulin, or for whom receipt of any blood product is anticipated during the course of study.
11. Any abnormality or chronic disease which according to the investigator might interfere with the assessment of the trial objectives.
12. Subject immunized with non-EPI vaccines.
13. Gastroenteritis in the 24 hours preceding dosing (temporary exclusion criteria).
14. Subject planning to move from the study area before the end of the study period.

overall_official.affiliation: Pediatric Research Office (PRO), Faculty of Medicine Universitas Gadjah Mada
